intro: Anthocleista zenkeri, commonly known as the African moonseed, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Loganiaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and alternate, simple leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, greenish-yellow flowers that are followed by elongated, spindle-shaped fruits. It is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forests and along riverbanks. The plant has been used in traditional medicine for its potential therapeutic properties.
